title: Royal Family Celebrates Christmas at Church
summary: The Royal Family, including King Charles, Queen Camilla, Prince William, and Catherine, went to a Christmas Day church service at Sandringham. Many people came to see them and waited a long time. They attended the service at St Mary Magdalene Church in Norfolk. After the church, they will spend Christmas at their Sandringham home. This is a special tradition for the family. King Charles will also give a Christmas message later in the day. The service is a big event where the family comes together in public.

questions.question: Is the Christmas service a tradition for the Royal Family?

background_read: Christmas is a holiday celebrated on December 25th. The Royal Family in the UK often has special events during this time. Sandringham is a big house where they meet for Christmas. A church service is when people go to church to pray and sing songs. King Charles is the king of the UK, and he gives a speech on Christmas Day to talk to everyone.
Article_Structure: WHO: King Charles, Queen Camilla, Prince William, Catherine, and other Royal Family members
WHAT: They attended a Christmas Day church service at Sandringham
WHERE: St Mary Magdalene Church in Norfolk, UK
WHY: It is a tradition for the Royal Family to come together and celebrate Christmas in public

perspectives.description: The service allows people to see the Royal Family and is a big celebration.
